page.title: 14The Chalk Pit, Burwell
page.content: This lake is privately owned by {"Mitcham B.C. Farms Limited".}It covers an area of over one acre. It used to be a chalk pit serving a cement works and the railway line ran past it. The last of the chimneys was pulled down in the 1940's. The lake now provides a home for lots of birds, insects, fish, plants and trees. These birds were among those seen: Great Crested Grebe, Kingfisher, Treecreeper and Turtle Dove, along with a range of butterflies, dragon flies, black tailed skimmers, blue damsel flies and bees. The plants seen included: Wayfaring Tree, Mallow, Old Man's Beard, White Briony, Poppy, Campion, Bulrush, Sedge, Reed, Dog Daisy, Cow Parsley, Forget-me-not and Ash, Elder, Sycamore and Willow trees which can all survive where the soil is wet.
